You must eat the soaked raisins along with water on an empty stomach in the morning. Note: Grapes is not a good option for those who are diabetic due to its high sugar content.

Eat one teaspoon of blackstrap molasses before going to bed. If you do not like the taste, you can mix it with milk, fruit juice or prune juice. If the problem persists, Increase the dosage to one to two tablespoons. Another rernedy is to mix two to three tablespoons of molasses with an equal amount of peanut butter and eat it in the morning. As molasses contains high calories, you must not follow these remedies on a daily basis.

Extract the juice of half a lemon and add it to a glass of warm water. You can also add a pinch of rock salt or one-half teaspoon of table salt and a little honey to it. Drink this nutritious lemon water first thing in the morning on an empty stomach. You can also drink a glass of this tasty drink in the evening. Follow this remedy daily to treat constipation within a few days. Alternatively, take 1 or 2 tablespoons of freshly squeezed lemon juice along with a pinch of salt daily for a few days to get relief from constipation and cleanse your system.

Grind 1 tablespoon of flaxseeds in a coffee grinder. Mix the powdered flax seed with 1-2 cups of water and allow it to rest for 15 minutes before drinking. Drink the water daily before going to bed. In the morning, your bowel movement will be much better. Alternatively, you can simply eat two to three tablespoons of ground flaxseeds with a glass of water. Note: When you eat flaxseeds, please drink a lot of water as it can cause abdominal discomfort.

Have 1-2 plums daily if you don't have prunes or have 3 to 4 prunes daily. Blend 2-3 prunes in some warm flax or almond milk and drink at night for extra fibre and relief from constipation. Take 3-4 chopped prunes and have it with a cup whipped yogurt daily.

Simply swallow one to two teaspoons of beneficial castor oil on an empty stomach. To improve the taste, you can take it with a fruit juice like orange juice. Within a few hours, you will notice a huge Improvement in your condition. Note: Castor oil can be toxic when taken in large doses. It can cause abdominal cramping when stimulating a bowel movement. You must not repeat this remedy for a prolonged period as it can cause side effects.
Take one cup of fennel seeds and dry roast them. Then, grind them and sieve the mixture. Store this tasty and digestive powder in a jar. Take half a teaspoon of this powder daily with warm water.
Take two to three almonds and dried figs. Soak them in water for a few hours. Peel the almonds and grind the ingredients. Take this paste with one tablespoon of honey at night.

To get rid of constipation, you must include spinach in your diet. You can eat it either raw or cooked, depending on how you like it. If you have severe constipation, drink a mixture of a one-half glass of raw spinach juice and one-half glass of water, twice daily. Within a few days, you will get much relief.

Add 1 tablespoon of minced ginger root to 1half cups of water. Bring the water to a boil, cover and let it soak for 5 to 10 minutes. Strain and drink this tea 2 or 3 times a day. Alternatively, mix together 1 teaspoon each of dried ginger powder, cumin powder, cinnamon powder and honey and have it 2 or 3 times a day. Note: Those suffering from high blood pressure should avoid ginger in high amounts.

Add 1 teaspoon each of dried chamomile flower and peppermint leaves to cup of hot water. Allow it to soak for 5 to 10 minutes. Strain and drink the tea at least 2 or 3 times a day. You can also make chamomile tea using pre-packaged tea bags.

Combine 1 teaspoon of cinnamon powder and half teaspoon of freshly grated ginger in a cup of boiling water. Cover and soak for 30 minutes. Drink this tea 2 or 3 times a day. Alternatively, add half teaspoon of cinnamon powder and 1 tablespoon of honey to a glass of warm water. Mix it well. Drink it 3 times a day. You can also sprinkle some cinnamon powder on a banana or in applesauce or yogurt before eating for even more benefit.

Drink 1 to 2 glasses of fresh pomegranate juice throughout the day. Put a handful of dried pomegranate peels in a cup of water. Bring it to a boil, then let it steep for 15 minutes. Strain and drink this liquid in small amounts throughout the day.
Eat boiled sweet potatoes seasoned with salt and pepper before bedtime to cure chronic diarrhoea.
Include starchy foods in your diet for a few days to help you feel better.

Drink boiled or filtered water throughout the day. If going out, do not forget to carry your own water bottle. Coconut water also helps keep you hydrated when experiencing diarrhoea. Drinking 2 to 3 cups of green tea is also beneficial. You can also drink pulp-free juices, clear chicken broths and caffeine-free soda. Electrolyte powder mixed in water is another good option.
Mix 1 to 2 tablespoons of raw, unfiltered apple cider vinegar in a glass of lukewarm water. Add a little honey and stir. Drink it 2 or 3 times a day until your condition improves.

Mix half teaspoon of turmeric powder in a glass of warm water. Mix it well and drink it fast, as the powder tends to quickly settle on the bottom. Drink it 2 or 3 times a day. Alternatively, add 1 teaspoon of turmeric powder to 1 tablespoon of applesauce or yogurt. Take it 2 or 3 times a day.

When dealing with diarrhoea, eat a ripe banana every few hours. You can even have ripe banana and yogurt smoothies, 2 or 3 times a day. Another option is to steam or boil a raw banana, mash it and then add a little lemon juice and a pinch of salt before eating.

When it comes to probiotics for diarrhoea, yogurt is the best option. It promotes a healthy environment of microorganisms in the digestive tract for better digestion. Eat 2 to 3 cups of yogurt a day when suffering from loose motion. Other good probiotic foods include kefir, miso, kimchi, tempeh, and buttermilk to name a few.

Add 5 grams of dried marshmallow root to one cup of boiling water. Soak for five minutes and then strain. Drink this herbal tea three times per day. Another option is to add two tablespoons of dried marshmallow root to one quart of water. Let it sit overnight. The next morning, strain and drink the liquid several times a day. Note: Avoid marshmallow if you have diabetes.

Add one-half teaspoon of liquorice root powder to a cup of water. Boil it for a few minutes and then strain it. Drink it 30 minutes before meals. Follow this remedy two or three times a day. You can also take liquorice tablets (380 to 1,140 mg per day), but only after consulting a doctor. Note: Those who have high blood pressure, heart failure, kidney disease or hypokalaemia should take liquorice under a doctor's supervision.
Add two to three teaspoons of dried chamomile to a cup of hot water. Cover and steep for five minutes. Strain and mix in one teaspoon of honey. Drink up to three cups of chamomile tea daily.

Cut a two-inch cube of ginger root into slices. Simmer the slices in one cup of water on low heat for 10 minutes and then strain it. Sip the liquid before your meal. Drink up to three cups of tea per day, one before each meal. You can also take ginger capsules. Take at least 2,000 milligrams three times daily. Consult your doctor before taking herbal supplements.

Mix one tablespoon of ground flaxseed in a glass of water. Drink it once before breakfast and again before going to bed. Also add ground flaxseed to cereal, yogurt, fruit and other healthy foods. You can use 15 gram of ground flaxseed per day.
Mix one teaspoon of slippery elm bark powder in two cups of boiling water. Add one teaspoon of sugar and a little bit of cinnamon powder. You can drink one to two cups of this solution twice a day.
Mix the juice of one lemon in a glass of warm water. Add a pinch of sea salt and a little honey to it and mix properly. Drink it on an empty stomach in the morning.

Remove the skin of one garlic clove and mince it thoroughly before ingesting it. Have this three times a day. Alternatively, you can take two garlic capsules three times daily. Consult your doctor before taking garlic supplements.
Simply drink one-half cup of aloe vera juice three times a day for at least one month.
You can also eat probiotic-enhanced foods like cultured yogurt or milk and soy beverages.

Add 1 or 2 teaspoons of dried chamomile flowers to 1 cup of hot water. Cover and allow it to soak for 5 to 10 minutes. Strain, then add some honey. Drink this tea several times daily for a week. Note: Do not boil this herb as its active compounds will be destroyed.

Add 1 tablespoon of dried strawberry leaves to a cup of hot water. Let it steep for 5 minutes, then strain. Drink it 2 or 3 times daily until the gastritis symptoms subside. To prevent gastritis, eat a few strawberries daily.

Add 1 teaspoon of fennel seeds to a cup of hot water. Cover and let it steep for 10 minutes. Strain and add a little honey. Drink it 3 times a day for a week. Also, chew fennel seeds thoroughly after a meal to relieve symptoms.

Add 1 teaspoon of freshly chopped ginger root to 1 cup of boiling water. Cover and steep for 10 minutes. Add honey and sip this tea slowly. Drink it 2 or 3 times a day for about a week. Alternatively, mix half tablespoon each of ginger juice and honey. Take it before eating your meal 2 times daily for a week. You can even chew a small piece of fresh ginger root or take ginger capsules to treat gastritis. Note: Ginger may interfere with blood-thinning and high blood pressure medications.

Add 1 teaspoon of liquorice powder to a cup of hot water. Cover, steep for 10 minutes and strain it. Drink this tea 2 or 3 times a day for a week. You can also take 250 to 500 mg of standardized glycyrrhizinate liquorice, or DGL extract, 3 times a day. If you are taking any other medicine, consult your doctor first.

Chew 4 to 5 leaves of holy basil slowly to treat stomach pain. Do this daily for at least a few weeks. Another option is to mix 1 teaspoon each of basil juice and ginger juice and drink it 2 or 3 times a day for a week. You can also drink basil tea with honey 3 times a day for a few weeks. To prepare basil tea soak 1 teaspoon of basil leaves in hot water for about 5 minutes and then strain it.
Eat 2 to 3 cups of plain probiotic yogurt daily until you get relief. You can also try a yogurt, banana and honey smoothie. Drink it 2 or 3 times a day for quick recovery.

Mix 1 teaspoon each of carom seeds and dried ginger with a little bit of black salt. Take 1 teaspoon of this mixture with a glass of warm water 3 times a day. Another option is to add 1 teaspoon of carom seeds powder and half teaspoon of black salt to a glass of buttermilk. Drink it 2 times a day. You can also boil 2 cups of water with 4 teaspoons of carom seeds until the water reduces by half. Strain the mixture and drink half cup of it 2 times a day.

Peel 1 to 2 raw potatoes and grate them. Put the grated potatoes on a strainer and press with a spoon to extract the juice. Dilute 1/2 glass of potato juice with a little warm water. Drink it 3 times a day, 30 minutes before each meal, for at least 1 to 2 weeks.

Take standardized, enteric coated peppermint tablets. Usually, 1 tablet 2 or 3 times daily is recommended, but it is best to consult a doctor before taking it. Enteric coated tablets will help avoid heartburn. You can also chew fresh peppermint leaves or add them to your soups, salads and smoothies.
Add one tablespoon of raw, unfiltered apple cider vinegar to a cup of water. Mix in one teaspoon of raw honey. Drink this solution two to three times a day for quick relief.

Add one teaspoon of basil to a cup of hot water and allow it to soak for 10 minutes. Drink up to three cups of this tea a day. Mix 5 or 6 ground basil leaves, half teaspoon of sea salt and a little black pepper powder in 2 to 3 tablespoons of plain yogurt. Consume it 2 or 3 times a day.

Add one teaspoon of roasted coriander seed powder to a glass of buttermilk and drink it once or twice a day. To reduce acidity in the stomach, extract the juice of fresh coriander leaves and mix one teaspoon of this juice in one cup of buttermilk. Drink it two or three times a day.

Drinking herbal tea after eating a heavy meal can greatly reduce indigestion. Dip your favourite herbal tea bag into a hot cup of water and cover it for five minutes. Drink it while it is still warm. Peppermint tea and chamomile tea help calm your stomach and relieve digestive problerns.

Dry roast, grind, and sieve fennel seeds. Take half a teaspoon of this powder along with water. Follow this remedy twice daily. Alternatively, you can drink fennel tea, made by soaking two teaspoons of crushed fennel seeds in a cup of hot water. Another option is to simply chew a spoonful of fennel seeds for symptom relief.

Grind together some carom seeds and dried ginger into a fine powder. Add one teaspoon of this powder and a little black pepper to a cup of warm water and drink it. Do this once or twice a day. Simply eating one-half teaspoon of carom seeds can also provide relief from indigestion.
Make a cup of cinnamon tea by adding one-half teaspoon of cinnamon powder to a cup of boiling water and let it soak for a few minutes. Drink it while it is still warm for best results.

Mix one teaspoon of roasted cumin seed powder in a glass of water and drink it. For heaviness in the stomach, add one-quarter teaspoon each of roasted cumin seed powder and black pepper to a glass of buttermilk and drink it two or three times a day for a few days.

Take two teaspoons of ginger juice, one teaspoon of lemon juice, and a pinch of table salt and black salt. Mix the ingredients thoroughly and consume it with or without water, whatever suits you. Another option is to add two teaspoons of ginger juice and one teaspoon of honey to a cup of warm water and drink it.

Add one tablespoon of oat bran to your breakfast cereal daily. Also, you can mix one-part oat bran with two parts water and cook it for a few minutes. Then eat it like oatmeal. You can also add one tablespoon of oat bran to yogurt, a smoothie or a salad.

Add one-half or one teaspoon of crushed fennel seeds to one cup of boiling water. Soak it for 10 minutes, strain and enjoy your herbal tea. You can have this herbal tea two or three times daily to prevent as well as reduce IBS symptoms. Alternatively, you can take one-half teaspoon of dry roasted fennel seeds powder twice daily with warm water.

Add one-half teaspoon of freshly grated ginger to a cup of hot water. Let it soak for 10 minutes, strain out the ginger, add some honey and then drink the tea. You can drink ginger tea two or three times a day to ease cramps and abdominal pain. Alternatively, you can grate a small piece of ginger and add one teaspoon of honey to it. Eat this mixture before having your lunch and dinner to get rid of diarrhoea as well as improve your digestive process. Note: Those suffering from high blood pressure should not use ginger remedies for IBS.

Add two or three drops of peppermint oil to one-fourth cup of warm water. Drink it three or four times a day. Continue until there is improvement in your condition. Also, you can add one teaspoon of dried peppermint to a cup of boiling water. Steep for 10 minutes. Drink this tea two or three times a day. Note: If taken in excess amounts, peppermint may cause nausea, loss of appetite, heart problems and nervous system disorders.

Eat one or two ripe bananas daily to maintain a healthy digestive system and prevent IBS. If you are having diarrhoea, mash one ripe banana and mix in one teaspoon of tamarind pulp and a pinch of salt. Eat it twice daily until the diarrhoea stops.

Put a few fresh carrots in a juicer to extract the juice. Add a few drops of lemon juice and a little bit of honey to the juice. Drink it several times a day until you notice improvement. You can also blend soft, cooked carrots in a blender with a little water to make puree. Add a little salt and eat one-half cup of carrot puree several times a day. Note: Avoid eating raw carrots if it causes stomach pain.

Put two to three teaspoons of dried chamomile flowers in a cup of boiling water. Let it steep for about 15 minutes. Strain it and add a little lemon juice. Drink this herbal tea about three times a day.

Take one tablespoon of freshly ground flaxseed with water, once daily. Alternatively, add one teaspoon of flaxseed to one cup of boiling water. Soak for five to 10 minutes and then drink this herbal tea before going to bed. Drink daily to keep your stomach clean and free from gas. You can also mix one tablespoon of flaxseed in a glass of water and allow it to rest for two to three hours. Drink the water daily before going to bed to promote smooth bowel movements.

Wash a fresh cabbage and cut it into small pieces. Put the pieces through a juicer or blender to make fresh cabbage juice. Drink one-half glass of this juice at a time, three to four times in a day. You must drink cabbage juice as soon as you start having constipation. Note: In some people, cabbage juice may cause bloating and flatulence.

You can eat yogurt as it is or make a smoothie. Have some several times a day until you notice improvement in your condition. Alternatively, mix one-half teaspoon of psyllium husks and one cup of yogurt. Eat it one hour after your lunch and dinner. Repeat daily until there is improvement.

A simple cure for a stomach-ache is to dissolve 1 1/2 teaspoon of ground cinnamon in 1 cup warm water, cover and let sit for 15 minutes, then drink it like tea. This remedy can also ease diarrhoea and flatulence.

Blend 2 tablespoons of freshly extracted aloe vera gel with 1 cup of water or sugar-free orange juice (or any other citrus juice) in a blender until smooth. Drink this once daily until your symptoms improve. Note: Do not take aloe vera in excess, as it can cause diarrhoea.

Eat a banana either before or after your meals. You can eat 2 to 3 bananas a day. For best results, sprinkle cinnamon powder on the banana before eating it. Apart from bananas, eating apples or ripe papayas is also beneficial.

Make 2 whole-wheat burnt pieces of toast and eat them slowly. You can have the toast with some cold milk, plain water or a cup of green tea. Note: Avoid white bread toast, as it can be harmful to your gut microbiota.
Mix 1 tablespoon of raw, unfiltered apple cider vinegar in a glass of warm water. Optionally, you can add some raw honey. Drink it before each meal to prevent a sour stomach.

One hour before eating your meal, take 1 capsule of activated charcoal with a full glass of water. After finishing the meal, drink another glass of water. Another option is to mix half teaspoon of activated charcoal powder in a glass of water and have it before eating your meal.

Put 1 to 2 teaspoons of dried chamomile flowers in a cup and pour boiling water over it. Cover and allow it to soak for 5 minutes. Add a little honey and drink it. Alternatively, if you are using chamomile tea bags, pour water over the bag, cover it and allow it to soak for 5 minutes. Remove the tea bag, add a little honey and drink the tea.

Slightly crush 2 teaspoons of fennel seeds and add it to 2 cups of water. Bring the water to a boil, then remove it from the heat and let it steep for 5 minutes. Strain the tea and drink it while it is still warm. Another option is to dry roast, grind and sieve a few tablespoons of fennel seeds. Take half teaspoon of this powder along with water after eating your meal. This mixture will last for several months.

When you're suffering from a sour stomach, ginger tea can help. To make the tea, put 1 teaspoon of fresh grated ginger in a cup and pour in boiling water. Cover it, let it steep for 10 minutes and strain it. Drink it 20 minutes before each meal. Another option is to add 2 teaspoons of ginger juice and 1 teaspoon of honey to a cup of warm water and drink it 2 times a day. A third option is to add half teaspoon of dry ginger powder to 1 cup of buttermilk. Mix it well and drink this concoction a few times a day.
Yogurt containing live active cultures is particularly good for relieving digestive troubles as it helps balance the gut bacteria that aid in digestion.

Boil one teaspoon of fenugreek seeds in two cups of water. Strain and drink it after adding a little honey to it. Another option is to consume one teaspoon of fenugreek seed powder along with milk. Alternatively, you can boll one cup of fenugreek leaves, add a little honey, and eat it twice a day. Follow any of these remedies twice daily for about a week.

Cut one half of a raw head of cabbage and two carrots into small pieces and put them in a blender to extract the juice. Drink one-half cup of this juice before each meal and at bedtime. Repeat daily for a few weeks. Be sure to use fresh juice each time.

Drink a few cups of fresh coconut milk or tender coconut water daily. Also, eat the kernel of the tender coconut. Follow this treatment for at least one week to get positive results. Alternatively, take one tablespoon of coconut oil in the morning and another at night for one week. As coconut oil is mainly composed of medium-chain fatty acids, it can be easily digested.

Garlic also helps treat stomach ulcers. Antibacterial and antimicrobial properties of garlic can keep levels of the Helicobacter pylori (H. pylori) bacterium in check, which contribute to the development of stomach ulcers. Simply take two to three crushed garlic cloves followed by a glass of water during the day. Do this daily to ease inflammation in the stomach and prevent stomach ulcers.

Mix one-eighth teaspoon of cayenne pepper in a glass of warm water. Drink it twice a day for the first two to three days. Gradually increase the amount of cayenne pepper up to one-quarter teaspoon twice daily for the rest of the week. Alternatively, take cayenne capsules that you can buy at health food stores. Take three capsules a day immediately after meals for one week. You can also add a pinch of cayenne pepper to soups, meats and other savoury dishes.

Mix one-half teaspoon of liquorice root powder in one cup of water. Cover it and let it sit overnight. The next morning, add one cup of cooked broken white rice (a grade of rice consisting of grains broken during the milling process) into this infusion and eat it. Repeat daily for one week to get positive results. Another option is to drink liquorice tea two or three times a day for one week. Alternatively, you can chew and then swallow two or three glycyrrhizinate liquorice (DGL) tablets three times a day for about a week. You can easily find these 380 mg tablets in health food stores.

Soak two to three wood apple leaves in one cup of water in a copper vessel overnight. The next morning, strain the mixture and drink it on an empty stomach. Follow this treatment daily for a few weeks.
Take the inner bark of the slippery elm and grind it into a powder. Mix one teaspoon of this powder in one cup of warm water. Drink this mixture three times a day for one week.
Take two tablespoons of raw honey daily, early in the morning on an empty stomach. It will help cleanse the bowel, strengthen the stomach lining, and prevent and treat stomach ulcers.

To treat an ulcer, eat at least three ripe bananas a day. If you do not like eating bananas, you can make banana milkshakes. Alternatively, peel two or three bananas and cut them into thick slices. Put the slices in the sun until they become dry. Grind the dried banana. pieces into a fine powder. Mix two tablespoons of this powder and one tablespoon of honey. Take this mixture three times a day for about a week.

Add one tablespoon of crushed fennel seeds to a cup of boiling water and allow it to soak for 10 minutes. Strain and drink this tea once or twice a day. Simply chewing a teaspoon of fennel seeds will also help combat the problem.

Add one tablespoon of dried mint leaves to a cup of hot water. Allow it to soak for 5 to 10 minutes. Strain and drink this tea. If fresh mint leaves are available, you can simply chew them. Alternatively, make a soothing solution by mixing one teaspoon each of mint juice, lemon juice and one tablespoon of honey. Consume it three times a day.
Boil a cup of rice in one to one and a half cup of water. Strain the solution. Drink this rice water.
Chew some cloves or use a few cloves to make a cup of tea to treat vomiting. Another way to use cloves during vomiting is to mix some fried cloves with honey and swallow it.

Cinnamon and sliced ginger work by interrupting nausea signals sent from the stomach to the brain, If you are an herbal tea drinker, simply sprinkle cinnamon on the tea and drink. To make ginger tea, simmer a few slices of ginger in hot tea water.
Eat 1/2 teaspoon of ground cumin seeds.

In a cup of boiling water, add one-half or one teaspoon of cinnamon powder. If you do not have the powder, simply use a cinnamon stick. Allow it to soak for a few minutes and then strain the water. Optionally, add one tablespoon of honey. Sip it slowly. Note: This remedy may not be suitable for pregnant women.

Mix one tablespoon of apple cider vinegar and one tablespoon of honey in a glass of water. Drink it and repeat as necessary. The smell of vomit can sometimes cause more vomiting. To freshen your breath and prevent further vomiting, rinse your mouth with one teaspoon of vinegar diluted in one-half cup of water.
Mix one teaspoon each of ginger juice and lemon juice and consume it several times a day. Alternatively, try some ginger tea with a little honey or eat some fresh ginger slices with or without honey.

Mix one teaspoon of onion juice with one teaspoon of grated ginger. Consume this mixture at regular intervals to cure vomiting. Another option is mix two teaspoons of honey in one-half cup of onion juice. Consume one tablespoon of this mixture. Repeat as needed.

Mix one-half teaspoon of ground cumin seeds in warm water and drink it. You can also mix one teaspoon of cumin seeds and a pinch of nutmeg in a cup of boiling water and let it soak for a few minutes. Strain the mixture and then drink it. Another option is to add some cumin powder and cardamom powder to one teaspoon of honey and take it slowly.
Sucking a piece of ice controls vomiting.

This is a very common yet effective home remedy for nausea and vomiting. Crackers have a mild flavour and are easy to digest. They also give you nutrition and energy for recovery. Simply eat some saltine crackers, pretzels, or even a dry toast.

Add one teaspoon of apple cider vinegar to a glass of water. Drink it twice daily. You can increase the dosage of apple cider vinegar up to two tablespoons per glass. If you have fluid retention in your legs, you can soak your feet in a warm foot bath made of equal parts of apple cider and warm water for about 10 minutes. It will also reduce foot odour.
Boil a cup of water mixed with one teaspoon of powdered nettle root. Let it soak for about 10 minutes. Drink this tea three times a day until you see improvement.
Boil a few raw onions in four cups of water. Add salt to taste and then strain the solution. Drink two or three cups of it a day for a few days.
Drink a cup of unsweetened cranberry juice daily for relief.
Mix two cups of Epsom salt in warm bathwater. Soak in it for about 15 minutes. Repeat up to three times a week.
Mix two tablespoons of lemon juice in a cup of warm water. You can also sweeten it with honey. Drink the solution. Continue taking this remedy once daily for a few days or until you see improvement.

Prepare parsley tea by putting two teaspoons of dried parsley leaves in a cup of boiling water. Let it steep for 10 minutes. Drink it up to three times a day. You can also drink a mixture of fresh parsley juice and lemon juice.
Put 20 drops each of geranium, cypress and juniper essential oils in a warm bath. Soak in it for at least 10 minutes. Do this three times a week.
Put one teaspoon of fennel seeds in a cup of hot water. Cover and let it steep for 10 minutes, then strain it. Drink this tea three times a day until you see improvement.

Steep one teaspoon of dried dandelion herb in a cup of hot water for about 10 minutes. Strain and drink this tea up to three times a day. You can also take dandelion tincture or supplements (500 mg one to three times a day). Before starting any herbal remedy such as dandelion tea, make sure you consult your doctor as it may interfere with certain drugs.
